column5: I've been fishing Quinte for over 50 years and have always been interested in the history of the region, and came across this article while researching the Hay Bay area this morning.  Thought some of you familiar with Hay Bay may find it interesting, I know I did.  http://www.aandc.org/research/drownings_hay_bay.html
Interesting stuff Lew! Why we never should pass a boat in need of assistance to this day.
Very interesting Lew...a lot of history in that area. I noticed that in the architecture while fishing there,Thanks.
Thanks for that post Lew.  I am a Picton native, as are all of my relatives.   I remember growing up my uncle's best friend was a Cole.  I wonder if there is any relation to this?
Very interesting, great read Lew, thanks

Very interesting story lew !!!! its cool how things have stories from long ago,and are usually forgotten until someone finds info on them,i wonder if therte is any roads or buildings named after them around there???...or if any of their relitives still down there ???...
